description:
I am so in love with Cafe St. Jorge.
Delicious coffee with almond / rice / soy milk. 
The breakfast is wonderful. You can enjoy the meal in a nice and friendly atmosphere. You can find for example Chia bowl with fresh berrys or Toast with Avocado on the menus. Also the fresh pressed juces are so great.
author: Alexandra H.

description:
Cafe St. Jorge (pronounced Jore-jee) is a nice, cozy coffee shop away from the tumult of the Mission. Every table was taken by people working on their laptops when we came on a Saturday afternoon.

It also has a nice array of homemade vegan baked goods. 

We got the vegan almond butter chocolate chip cookie ($3) which had good flavor, but slightly dry, crumbly texture.

The slices of vegan strawberry cake and coffee-chocolate swirl cake ($4 each) were phenomenal, though---they were moist and substantial and nicely sweet. Everyone loved these.

We also enjoyed our almond latte and capuccino. 

Come to Cafe St. Jorge for a vegan Portuguese treat.
author: Kedar D.

description:
Friendly good coffee and outstanding service! 

Had the cold coffee and it was great! 

Had an avocado sandwich and it was on point . Already been here many times and punched a card so I like it!
author: Paul D.

description:
Yelp has been asking me for over a year to finish this review, so i will.

$50, two people. Light Breakfast. Eggs, bland. Shakes, either taste like nothing or too sweet. They hide their poor quality with a dash of black pepper, so we don't ask too many questions. 

Outdated menu. You aren't using any worthwhile alternative sweeteners, instead opting for honey and dates and disregarding evolving taste pallets. 

Do the things you do well, like the coffee and baked good and leave the rest alone. Not worth the money.
author: Rain F.

description: Nice little cafe.. the place seems to be a popular neighborhood spot because this little place got crowded fast, no doubt helped by some yoga studio nearby I guess I felt left out not carrying a yoga mat ... we ordered the Smoked Salmon Toast and the Savory Waffle to which I added scrambled eggs. What can I say, I mean it's toast and a waffle...ok the waffle, Belgian, was tasty on its own and the avocado and plant life were visibly fresh and nice on the palette. As someone who makes Green Juice at home, the green juice here was yummy. Let's face it, these items can and are easily made at home, but when you're out and about or just don't cook... this is good stuff.
author: Orlando J.

description:
This review has been in my "unfinished review" queue for quite some time, so it's time to clean house...

I visited Cafe St. Jorge with my vegan Yelp friend, Regina, back in February. She was very gracious and met up with me when I needed to work and she found a place with vegan options that was laptop friendly. She actually did a very good job reviewing this place for the both of us, so I'll keep the rest short.

Yes, they don't offer vegan matcha lattes, they should consider adding these to their menu since match is exploding in popularity these days. Moreover, while they offered a number of vegan baked goods, I found them to be average.

I'd work from this cafe again if I'm in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so since they only offer tea and no tea lattes.
author: Christina M.

description: Excellent sandwich board.  Great Stumptown coffee.  Super ambiance.  I had a delicious apple turnover as well.
author: Loren B.

description:
The high ratings intrigued me and this has been bookmarked for ages.

I believe the high ratings are just b/c this is a unique place for this neighborhood. My neighborhood has a bunch of places similar.

I forgot to take photos of the food (only of my man's mocha - which he enjoyed)

We ordered the savory waffle with Prosciutto and baby arugula and the "Portuguese breakfast" - The photos I saw on yelp has the Portuguese breakfast as more of like a chacuterie  board - with all items deconstructed. But I guess the current version is basically ham and cheese on a baguette, which was good, but not as much fun as an "assemble it yourself" situation.

So all in all it was fine, but nothing I am clamoring to get back to.  (try the great Mexican across the street El Buen... (something)
author: Amy W.

description:
I was looking for a vegan friendly place to meet up with my friend where we could get coffee/tea and which was known to be laptop friendly if she wanted to stay and work on her computer afterwards. I also wanted a place that had at least some vegan food since I hadn't eaten breakfast yet. This place seemed to fit all of those criteria and had a high rating, so I recommended that we go here. 

This place is located in Bernal Heights and street parking is free on Sundays, but you will likely still have to park a couple blocks away and walk. They don't have matcha lattes here if that is your drink and while they serve Stumptown Coffee, my mocha turned out so bad it was practically undrinkable. While they had clearly marked vegan options on their menu, most of them where on the sweeter side and I prefer savory vegan breakfast a lot more. 

For food my friend ordered a vegan blueberry muffin and I ordered avocado toast and vegan banana bread (which they ran out of and I switched to chai coffee cake). My avocado toast was good, but nothing I would go out of my way to seek out again and the coffee cake was just okay too. 

Really if the coffee sucks, it's pretty much impossible for me to give higher than a 3 star review. The only thing keeping this review lower than 3 stars for me was their menu was vegan friendly with clearly marked options. 

I don't plan on coming back.
author: Regina W.

description:
Hole in the wall in Bernal Heights.

The menu is simple and straightforward. The interior has a harbor cafe feel. The food was simple and came in small bites.

Also enjoyed seeing how active many people were working whether it was for school or coding.
author: John Kevin G.

description: Delicious coffee and cute food that is made to order. Lost a star for the high prices, but its catered to techies so I guess its expected now with the sky-high rents and cost of living. The coconut drink was delicious, and the toast was beautifully presented. I had a cup of coffee that was off the charts good.
author: Peter C.

description: This place is super cute!  I loved my Americano, as well as my "almond tartlette"!  The service was friendly, and the setting is cozy, inviting, and comfortable.  A lovely place to pop in for (or linger over) a coffee.
author: Barnali D.

description: This cafe is cozy and homey. I came here in the afternoon so I didn't want coffee. Luckily they had pressed juices! I also got a Nata ($3) and it was delicious. The WiFi here is really fast too. There place is a great cafe to meet with friends and catch up. I hope to try the coffee and toast next time!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
I had a very negative experience here in the past, but decided to give the place another shot today since I was meeting up with a friend from out of town. 

I ordered the blood orange citrus juice and a strawberry shortcake muffin. Both were okay but nothing impressive and my bill came out to $11. For the price I would have expected more.

Ambiance is nice. I like the bench out front so you can enjoy your purchase there when the weather is nice. The employees were friendly and helpful. 

Overall, I wouldn't come back since there are plenty of other good eateries and coffee shops nearby.
author: Shav S.

description: Small cafe with a nice selection of breakfast items ranging from egg sandwiches, assorted pastries & chia bowls. The light coffee was delicious, several different non dairy creamers options were available.  I had the coconut cinnamon chia, the flavors were tasty tho next time I would probably apt to add a topping for a bit more texture as the coconut flakes only went so far. Also a bit of music piping through the cafe would have elevated the experience as it was almost deafeningly quiet.
author: Kymberly C.

description: Best vegan selection of pastries in SF! New varieties are baked in-house all the time. I had a fantastic Rhubarb muffin awhile back and the Raspberry Matcha last week was so good! The cafe always plays really good music and is a perfect Sunday morning spot to read the paper and start the day.
author: Grace C.

description: Pricey but worth it. Ham and cheese croissant is my jam, nitro cold brew is the bomb and I'm convinced the Portuguese cheese has meth in it.
author: Chase K.

description:
Me and my exercise group come here just about every Saturday when we finish working out. Service is fast and the menu is extensive. They even have gluten free items for my buddy! The ownership here is very considerate of every patrons thoughts about improvement. No one is perfect but this place is making progress and willing to improve. My wife loves the avocado toast and I enjoy the Tosta Mista grilled sandwiches a bunch. 

If I HAD to make an improvement, I would suggest sampling some the Perri Peri hot sauce they sell or offer it at the cafe so patrons can taste what they are going to purchase.

Thank you Cafe St. Jorge for being in the neighborhood!
author: Vince W.

description:
Coffee. A+
Food. A+
Service. A+
Parking. C (you better live nearby or be patient)

Every single thing I've ordered here...amazing. The pastries as well as the egg sandwich as well as the smoked salmon toast. Yes, and thank you.

Their coffee - I always get the drip. Note that a refill is $1. Not that bad of a price.
author: Amy O.

description: Oh my gosh! This place is so great. I went here today and got the orange blossom waffle with fruit on top and a Portuguese pastry. They were both super super super delicious! Everything about this cafe is so great, would highly highly recommend. Also love that they have free postcards--a super cute touch.
author: Annika S.

description:
Been meaning to check this place out since it opened and glad I finally did! The menu can be overwhelming so I suggest you take a minute to look it over before getting in line so you don't feel pressured to order something before you're ready. There is a ton of yummy stuff on the menu and I had a hard time deciding. I ended up getting coffee and the baked egg breakfast sandwich with smoked salmon. My friend got the grilled cheese and the bottomless iced tea. They are pretty fast with the refills but you do need to bring the cup to the counter and they have different prices if you want bottomless coffee or just a cup of one which I thought was interesting. 

We were both still hungry so we shared one of their toasts which was bigger than both our previous dishes. We got the banana almond butter toast. Their toasts and waffles are super photogenic as is the entire cafe itself. Super cute and lots to look at. They have art and merch for sale as well. The owner was going around telling people to get off their laptops although it was weird because one row of seating had signs regarding the laptop allowed schedule but seems like it's not really followed by the guests or the staff.
author: Tiffany V.

description: I heard a lot about the chia bowl, and I finally got to try one. I'm a fan. They also have nice toast options. Get in on that avocado game. Cafe St. Jorge has a calm, bright vibe in a community-oriented environment. Great place to catch up with friends over a relaxed meal. Definitely recommend if you're in the area.
author: Joanna L.

description:
This is a terrific place to burn through your mortgage on avocado toast if you're into that sort of thing. If you're not so much into that, there's plenty of other options available in the locally-sourced fresh-buzzword carbohydrate category. There's pretty good lunch options - their Toasta Mista is my go-to when I'm working from home and remember to eat. On the coffee front, it's good, and their espresso drinks are well made. 

The early morning staff is friendly and nice. I miss Andrea, but the new owners have done a good job of keeping Cafe St. Jorge's particular Euro-charm. (I also miss Joe, but this is a worthy successor to the Nervous Dog of years ago.)

Be advised, the wait to find somewhere to sit inside on a weekend morning will be something just short of eternity.
author: Jon G.

description: I've gone here twice- once for a show on the weekend and once during the week to do work. The cafe is pricy like the other reviewers mentioned but it's a good, airy place to get work done for a couple of hours.
author: Thu P.

description: Pro vegan tip: try the orange blossom waffle. The iced tea lemonade is also delicious! Love this understated cafe and especially love their vegan waffle!
author: Vijay N.

description:
Yum yum yum. Get the breakfast slider, the smoked salmon toast and go healthy and go sweet with the coconut chia pudding - it'll be worth it 
The outside facade might be deceiving, but it's quaint on the inside.
author: Christian M.

description: This place is super cute! My friend and I stumbled upon the cafe when we were walking around looking for something to eat for breakfast. I got a latte and that was pretty good nothing out of the ordinary. I wish I got the golden turmeric toddy my friend ordered.  I also got the egg breakfast slider. This. Was. Awesome! The salty cheesy scramble eggs was so fluffy and perfectly cook. That with the sweet brioche buns was the perfect combo. The arugula added a nice spicy note as well.
author: Suthida K.

description: Just awful first experience. Coffee was weak. I asked for a cup to stay and they ignored that and gave it to me in a paper cup--felt like they were encouraging me to leave. Zero seating because of poorly placed tables (one right in the middle of the line to the counter). Not a welcoming environment. I stood for about 10 minutes while my weak cup of coffee got cold, then handed it back to them. I hope they give me the refund I requested. Won't be back.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Best place for coffee and light organic food 100%
 very popular also great customer service
author: Yenis K.

description:
Lovely staff and really nice healthy choices! 
Had the avocado on toast and the salmon on toast both really nice! 
The green drink is delicious and nutritious but I'm sure a little too much sugar but worth it! 
I was here for a week and had breakfast at this spot twice.
author: James H.

description:
16.04.29   1st Visit

Nice coffee shop.
Mid size
The Portuguese bolo de arroz ... yum

It was a short visit, but a nice one
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Saturday afternoon, we were in the neighborhood and wanted to grab something to-go and this place seemed great!

We ordered the Avocado Toast, Persimmon Toast, and Hot Chocolate. Here's what I thought: 

-Avocado Toast $6: Thick multigrain toast, lots of smashed avocado, lemon, and chili flakes. 

I loved the brightness of it (color and taste wise), but I didn't like the bread here. It wasn't toasted well enough which made the whole toast a little less appetizing. 

-Persimmon Toast $6: Thick multigrain toast, cream cheese, persimmon slices, granola, and honey. 

I initially wanted the Fig Toast (it's seasonal?), but this one was FANTASTIC! The bread was the same, but toasted better which was an overall better texture. There are lots of textures on the toast itself and flavors that danced well together. I would love to have this again!

-Hot Chocolate $4ish: Quite good, but not sweetened much. I prefer that over overly sweetened, but I probably wouldn't get this again.

If I had only had the Persimmon Toast, my rating would be higher but I did feel underwhelmed by the rest of the order.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Nothing short of genius if you ask me. What am I talking about? Fig toast, of course. But first, let's talk about this Portuguese-inspired cafe in Bernal Heights. This was Nervous Dog, I remember, and playing in a much lower key back then, but now its refreshed identity appears to be percolating with life. It did remind me of the pastelerias of Lisbon where you get a cup of strong coffee and a pastel de nata, which is an egg custard tartlet similar to the ones at Golden Gate Bakery except with a slightly burnt topping that gives it a crunch. I would have been gobsmacked if they served them here but alas, I saw none. In fact, I saw little because it was pretty packed.

So when I got up to the counter, I just happened to notice on a little sign in the back that said they served a $6 Fig Toast. Oh my, sounded good and it was with honey date cream cheese spread on pan de mie bread, then covered with slices of fresh brown turkey figs, drizzled with honey, and sprinkled with fresh crushed pepper (photo: http://bit.ly/2boy1Hv). It was just terrific and something I've since replicated at home as I thought it was so good. I accompanied that confection with the $3.85 Galão which was well brewed and a smooth complement (photo: http://bit.ly/2byX5MB). If not for the relentless bustle on a Saturday afternoon, I'd definitely make it more of a habit to come for this touch of Lisbon. 

FOOD/COFFEE - 4.5 stars...that fig toast was a pure gem
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...frenzied but maybe this is a tribute to Lisbon, too
SERVICE - 4 stars...good and solid
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely a place to hang if you don't mind the crowds...and oh yes, that fig toast
author: Ed U.

description: This was such an adorable place with some really great vegan options. There was non vegan as well. I has avocado toast and my partner had the breakfast slider. We also has a 12oz smoothies and a black coffee. While everything was tasty and fast, we paid $34. I do think this was pretty expensive for the amount we got. But, food and service was great.
author: Kayla C.

description:
Food:
-Orange Blossom Waffle - This was pretty good and had a kick to the batter.  The most impressive thing was the presentation of it all.
-Portuguese Egg Tart - There are a ton of pastries on the cash wrap but this one is what I wanted to try out of them all.  Definitely didn't disappoint.

Service:  It's more of a self serve place where you bus your own tables but the staff was very nice.

Ambiance:  I went here on a rainy day and its lucked out with the line apparently.  But despite the fact that it was raining it was still packed.  

Overall:  Good experience
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Officially my favorite spot for breakfast in San Francisco.  Not brunch - which is an over-hyped, social drinking occasion - but breakfast, where you can relax and actually have a good meal.

The vibe is great, servers as friendly, the food comes out quickly, and - while there can definitely be a line - it's never unmanageable. They also always have cool art on the walls - right now, it's a series of Pokemon characters painted over ornate, vintage artwork.  In addition, they play great music - like Leon Bridges - and often have live music in the evening.

Their food is so good.  My favorite items are the Chia Bowl - which uses their housemade almond milk and tons of delicious fresh and dried fruit and nuts - and the Goose is Loose sandwich.  Who would have thought ham+cheese+banana could be so delicious!  Their baked egg breakfast slider is also very good - I recommend adding ham and avocado.  They also have an impressive assortment of pastries, good coffee, and Lady Falcon Coffee Club beans by the bag to take home (yay!)

I could literally come here every weekend...
author: Tay H.

description:
Such a great find on a small block of Mission St. 

I had the chia bowl and avocado toast which was nothing short of delicious. This is a quiet cafe I would recommend visiting for a quick bite alone or to have a coffee and small meal with a friend. 

The coffee is good too ;)
author: Irina R.

description: My favorite neighborhood cafe. Almond butter toast  + get cozy are my go-tos! Lines could get long, but I love to meet friends here.
author: So-Rim L.

description:
Came back once again, always great food. 
.
Got 
..
The 
..
Waffle blossom 
.....
Yummmmmmm!!!!'
author: Mike R.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops to get work done. Great healthy food options, good coffee, and fast WiFi with plenty of outlets. Really busy on the weekends so you may not be able to find a table. Usually not that busy on weekdays. Recommend the beet toast and the Portuguese egg tart.
author: Anna H.

description:
I usually get food at least once a week from here since they opened, I was happy to see a place like this on the neighborhood. However, lately It has been so disappointed! I gave a lot of tries before giving one star but that's it!
Today my quinoa spiced salad was taste less, the kale had thick stems, and the quinoa was over cooked and salty! 
Last week my avocado toast had about half of the avocado that usually has... plus my banana bread was still uncooked is the middle! 
Service has always being slow and people working over there just take it so easy!
Missing the original idea and good of this place!
author: K M.

description:
Loved it! Coffee is decently priced and Stumptown is always a big plus in my book. Try an iced latte with almond milk--it's super smooth and will likely empty my wallet over the course of this summer. 
Went there for brunch and tried the "famous" chili flake avocado toast and it was great--big, thick piece of bread with a generous helping of avocado smeared on top, and a sprinkling of chili flakes give it an unexpected kick. Would have loved a fried egg or something on top, but it was really good for the price. 
The staff is very kind and the place just has a nice feel to it. Decently busy on a weekend morning, and they do have a 1-hr dining policy (plus no laptops allowed on weekends 10am-2pm) so I wouldn't plan on coming here to get a lot of work done, but there is wifi if you stop by for a bit.

Definitely looking forward to spending some more weekend mornings here!
author: Gautam G.

description: This is such a great cafe with great coffee (Stumptown), food and prices. I tried the Portuguese breakfast board with baguette, Zoe's meat ham, Portuguese cheese and also the smoked salmon wheat toast with cream cheese. It's worth the trip from Union Square just to eat here.
author: Sarah T.

description: Love the food per my prior post and since the last time we came something magical happened and everyone working here was not only pleasant they were providing real service! Major improvements on the customer service! And love that with the bottomless coffee you can get one to go! You have reserved your permanent place in my heart as favorite brunch in sf!
author: Morgan S.

description: Green juice was delicious - on the sweeter side. Cute decour. Avocado toast was big. Salad was well dressed.
author: Natalie L.

description: This place has changed since it first opened. Food and drinks are still good, but the staff is nowhere near as friendly. I get that it's a busy place, but I use to know everyone's names and felt very welcomed. Since the ownership switch the staff is much more aloof and it doesn't feel like a neighborhood centered business anymore
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Breakfast slider- price was a bit steep for the size. $6 plus 75cents for ham. It tasted really good but not for that price.

Orange blossom waffle- couldn't taste the orange, waffle was crispy and cooked just right.


Will come back and try other affordable options.
author: Kai A.

description:
This place looked so good on Yelp that I decided to come all the way down to Bernal Heights to check it out. Maybe I ordered the wrong things but the taste of the food and drinks were mediocre, making the presentation a bit deceiving. 

The only thing I did like: vegan pumpkin bread!!! Soooo good 

I got the chai latte - too spicy for my liking. I only drank 1/4 of it and ended up just drinking water. The Chia Bowl had great ratings, but little did I know that small bowl was worth $9!!! I ordered it without checking the price (lesson learned). Not sure why people were raving about it. It's just chia seeds with slices of banana and strawberries. 

Beware, no laptops allowed from 10am-2pm on saturdays if you were planning to do some work on the weekends. There are plenty of plugs though. Wifi connection wasn't too strong. Overall, I don't think I'd make a trip to come here again.
author: Christine C.

description:
Their granola is absolutely delicious and they have hemp milk here, too! Hemp milk...say whatttt? :)

I ordered a vanilla hemp milk latte and it reminded me of being back in Portland...this is my new go-to spot whenever I am in the Mission.  Super cute and chill for work, too.

Update: 10/06/16
Came here again and the latte was not good.  It was an almond milk latte that was definitely burned.  I spoke with the manager and she was friendly and offered to make another one but I definitely didn't wanna risk having the same issue occur again...

Had the peanut butter toast as well  Peanut butter was good but the bread wasn't as tasty as The Mill's.  

May return for the granola but that's about it.
author: Monica J.

description: This is a cute cafe with great food. They offer an assortment of tea and coffee drinks. It's a cozy place to get Sunday brunch or to do work on the weekday.
author: Doriana B.

description: I can't believe it took my this long to find this gem of a coffee spot. Not only is the ambiance great but so is the coffee and food. I had the smoked salmon toast and it was delicious. I would recommend this for a quick breakfast and great coffee. Will definitely be returning!
author: Courtney N.

description:
I really like the look of the place. Its warm, welcoming and surprisingly spacious. They have plenty of seating (although plugs seem sparse) and on a Saturday morning it's busy but not overwhelming.

Unfortunately the speed of their service is lacking. I noticed that myself and others around me haven't received our food for quite a while. I've been waiting 20 minutes for a toast (edit: toast with butter & sea salt tasted amazing! A touch of too much butter but the toast was thick and toasted perfectly).. not sure how that takes much longer than a few minutes (edit: apparently they give out food the order it comes in.. democratic sure, but not at all efficient--I got my toast 30 min later after inquiring about it 20 min in). I ordered a regular cup of coffee and it's pretty good. Not amazing but that's what I expected getting something brewed in such a large quantity. The prices are a bit steep, but if you're willing to dish out ~$10 for a bowl of chia pudding then I'm sure you'd enjoy this place.

Overall I'll probably be back. More for the convenience of the location and the comfy interior than for anything else.
author: Angelina H.

description:
Everything at Cafe St. Jorge is delicious. I especially appreciate their eclectic selection of food items. You have your more traditional food like waffles, but then there's also grilled paninis, acai bowls, and delicious avocado toast. 

Most recently my husband and I stopped in and ordered the Goose is Loose (a grilled sandwich with ham, cheese, and banana...sooo good!), smoked salmon toast, and fresh pressed juice. They were out of the green juice, but the server recommended the juice with lemon, cayenne, ginger, and apple. I was a little skeptical, but took her advice and damn if it wasn't delicious. Totally hit the spot and made me feel pretty good. 

I appreciate that they don't let people have laptops out on weekends to keep the crowd moving. During the week it seems like a pretty sweet spot to set up shop. I always see a lot of people in here with kids, which is great. We need more places in SF that are kids friendly.
author: Casey S.

description: I wanted to have an alone time one Saturday morning and found that it wasn't too busy at Cafe St. Jorge so I gave it a try. Probably one of the best decisions I've made because I fell in love with their avocado and chili toast. I am very picky with what I eat and I have to crave my meal almost all the time. I ordered it without looking at pictures nor reviews on yelp. I look forward to every bite while I enjoy my almond milk latte. Definitely one of my faves and will always come back here.
author: Gwen M.

description: Organic choices bring me here. Great service, chill area and beautiful food and coffee.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
New favorite coffee shop - beautiful latte and interesting menu items.  The egg tart is so rich and perfectly flaky (extra points because they serve them heated).  The goose is loose was the biggest surprise - grilled ham and cheese with banana!  They hit the sweet and savory note perfectly.   The cheese was mild and perfectly melted.  All the toasts looked beautiful and fully loaded - the smoked salmon with avocado was so nice because they added fresh lemon juice over it.  Really well balanced.  The chia bowl was artfully prepared with sliced fruit, cocoa dusted nuts and chewy dried fruits (including maybe dates and cherries).
Perfect place for coffee and a snack (or meal!).
Would like to try the savory waffle next time.
author: jennifer m.

description:
This was my first stop during my weekend birthday trip to San Francisco. I don't know why, but I had a desire to go here which required a twenty to thirty minute walk in the rain. It was worth it.

The staff was super laid-back, upbeat and friendly. The chia bowl filled with bananas, strawberries, hemp granola, pumpkin seeds, figs, and other goodies was naturally-flavorful and fillings.

To top it all off, they were playing Elton John songs and had Pokemon art on the walls. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for a casual breakfast/lunch/coffee.
author: Jacob M.

description: Delicious brunch spot in an unassuming area near the end of Mission Street. Not only is the food delicious (we had granola, yogurt, some egg dishes), the presentation is stellar. Wish this spot was closer to my house, I'd make it a weekly habit!
author: Erin W.

description: Best pasteis de nata!!  Great coffee.  Very friendly staff.  Can't wait to come back to try some other stuff on the menu!
author: Brigitte C.

description:
Such a cute, inviting cafe with a large selection of pastries and breakfast drinks and delights. I really enjoyed the green smoothie - extremely light and refreshing. Of course, the avo toast is a solid choice, exactly as described on the menu. The bagels are good too, just not as large as expected. 
I would definitely recommend the chia bowl, particularly if you like things on the sweeter end; it was a perfect blend of dates, nuts, and seeds. The prices are pretty standard for SF.
author: Lucy G.

description:
This place was recommended to us by a friend. It's definitely a place that is unique and worth a visit.

That being said, it is definitely more American than Portuguese. I am saying that having visited Portugal for a week and tasting authentic food. The food here is very American with Portuguese inspiration. That being said, things were cooked spot on and were all tasty.

Commenting on the price, things are definitely overpriced. The place did not have a sit-down feel, but charged rates matching that. If you wanted a coffee refill, you had to get up to get it.

On food - I really enjoyed the Baked Egg Breakfast Slider (I would order again if I came back). It was definitely smaller than expected though. I also ordered a Pasteis de Nata (famous in Portugal). This was a very tasty treat, but did not taste authentic at all. My husband ordered a Chia bowl and he was somewhat disappointed. It looked good, but not very filling. 


On drinks - the coffee is a strong roast and has excellent flavor - would order again. The Golden Tumeric Toddy was unique but it was served more luke warm (we were expecting the same temp as the coffee).
author: Elisha G.

description:
Love the goose is loose! I was skeptical to try it after seeing ham, cheese, AND banana. But I am a sucker for trying out new and unusual flavors, and I was pleasantly impressed with this one!! 

The cheese was so cheesy and there was just enough banana so it's not overwhelming. As you can tell I was feeling quite adventurous today and also decided to try a hemp milk latte for the first time. I didn't end up liking it (although I tried, I really tried). I'm normally a black coffee drinker so I think the hemp milk and espresso was just a notch too far for me, personally. 

Their tradition Portuguese baked goods look so good I just had to get a couple to try!

Either way, I would definitely come here again. The portions are pricey for their size but I personally was thrilled to not be so full upon leaving. Seating wasn't too bad, I came in on a Saturday at noon and was able to grab a seat. Although it was pretty busy. 

Next time I plan on trying out their granola or chia pudding which looked yummy as well.
author: Margaret K.

description:
Loved this place! I came to try the unicorn toast but would definitely stay for the waffle with added fruit. The toast was good, sadly a little burnt and dry but very interesting to try. 

The waffle was amazing. Soft, flavorful, not too bready, and the fruit was perfectly ripe and extremely flavorful. Latte was good and smooth, but they sadly forgot the added vanilla flavor. 

The atmosphere is wonderful. Beautifully decorated. I would definitely love to spend many more rainy mornings behind their doors.
author: Monica M.

description:
Star Rating 1-5

Staff Friendliness: 5
Staff Knowledge: 5
Staff Efficiency: 5
Transaction Time: 5
Order Wait Time: 5
Register Counter Cleanliness: 5
Kitchen / Prep Area Cleanliness: 5
Dining Area Cleanliness: 5
Bathroom Cleanliness: 3
Food Handling (i.e. clean hands): 5
Food Presentation (i.e. wrapping, boxing): 5
Food Preparation (i.e. made with care): 5
Food Value: (i.e. worth the price): 5
Food Taste: 5
author: Charlie A.

description:
Cafe St. Jorge, a homey place where everyone is your homie.

The place sports a large selection of food and pastries. There's also plenty of room. However, I really want to focus on what made me fall in love with ol' St. Jorge -- the service.

The staff was extremely helpful. Rarely will you find people willing to help you out this early. 

Quick aside: I was sad to hear they ran out of baguettes. Fortunately, they offered me a more expensive entree -- free of charge!

If that was to get me to return, then it worked. 

I'll be coming back.
author: Ian I.

description: This is my go-to place to do writing in San Francisco. They have killer coffee and the best granola and yogurt I've ever had. Plenty of other great options and very kind staff. Glad to have them in the neighborhood.
author: Josh L.

description: Loved the toast options. I had the avocado chili and my daughter had gf with almond butter and banana. Coffee was divine. Great atmosphere- bright and relaxed. Wish we could have returned during our quick visit to SF but hopefully next trip!
author: Sarri T.

description: Cozy breakfast/lunch spot serving one of my favorite coffee - Stumptown!
author: Mei S.

description:
Such a cute little cafe in Bernal Heights / Outer Mission, with a wide variety of baked goods, coffee, breakfast and lunch food, all at affordable prices. If you want to indulge in something comforting, you can find muffins, breads, homemade pop tarts, cookies, etc. or go the healthier route with chia bowls, avocado toast, smoothies, etc.

They also have Stumptown cold brew on tap or in cans, which is always delicious, or a variety of other coffee drinks, mochas, teas, etc. They have some seasonal drinks also, and for Fall/Winter 2016, they have a peppermint mocha on the menu.

They are probably more famous for their avocado toast, which is pretty reasonably priced at $5.95 for a slice of toast, mashed avocado with lemon and chili flakes -- and at a decent portion size. My favorite avocado toast of all time still stands with Jane on Fillmore or Jane on Larkin, but this is a top contender for top 3 in the city for the quality and the price.

The chia bowl that we had was delicious and healthy, with almond milk, cinnamon, freshly sliced fruit and dried figs and fruit. It is sweetened with agave, but it was not too sweet, and a good portion size.

The one drawback is that they only serve waffles until 2 pm (so go early / accordingly if this is what you want), and the food is not super quick to come out but that's probably because they are making each thing to order which is fine since it's fresher that way.

4.5 stars (if I can give half star ratings) for a super cute coffee shop that is fairly crowded, but enough seating so that you can come have a nice lunch or hang out with friends, or do some work or read a book. They also have a stack of board games and books for you to peruse. I'd definitely come back here and get the avocado toast and/or the chia bowl again, and would love to try some of their delicious-looking baked goods (all made in house, with the exception of the egg tarts)
author: Christina L.

description: They've got Especie cookies!  The first bite brought me back to my childhood and brought a tear to my eye. It inky got better after I sipped on a perfect espresso made by the gracious Ali. I had the grilled cheese too which was pure cheesy perfection. Definitely a place to check out.
author: Hiram T.

description:
I loved everything about this place - great atmosphere, great service, great food! 

Got the mocha smoothie with espresso and some avocado toast. I also got a blueberry muffin and almond butter cup for later.

My one "complaint" is that I wish they toasted the bread for the avocado toast. Otherwise it was perfect! 

Also this Almond butter cup - better than even Reese's and it's vegan & gluten free but oh my god DELISH. 

The smoothie was the perfect texture and blend of flavors. And the muffin was amazing the next day heated up with a pat  of coconut oil.

Definitely give this place a visit before exploring bernal heights!
author: Kait S.

description: Food is amazing! The lemonade is the bomb! Fun people watching too...i just wish the flow of ordering/seating was a little smoother. It gets a little tight when parents insist on squeezing in strollers the size of a smart car!
author: Pattie S.

description:
I'm not sure what's going on, but lately the customer service is seriously concerning. Anyone behind the counter taking your order addresses you in such a manner that is incredibly rude and almost condescending. Why all the attitude and still expect a tip? It's customary to at least leave a 15% tip, but this last visit was 0% and will continue to be this way given the treatment. The employee who flipped the screen to view what I had tipped them turned over to the other employee making coffee and rolled her eyes. Then you take a few steps back and comment on your lack of tip due to your excellent customer service skills??? How does that work?! I can still hear you Ms Employee of the month ugh. 

I refuse to give you my hard earned money when you greet and treat me with such disrespect. Initially I thought it was personal, catty female behavior, but sadly this seems to be the ongoing theme.  Because I am addicted to some of the items on the menu, is my only reason for contributing to this business. I literally eat and leave.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Breakfast sandwich 4.5 w smoked salmon 4.6 w ham and Avocado 4.7

Cappuccino 4.5




. 


.,.... 

.. 


0.

.
.. 

.. 
.. 
. 
.. 
. 

. 

..... 
... 

. 
..
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is a great place to come and sit and play on your laptop. Everyone here is on their laptop which is cool, its hard to find a place that allows yo to sit and work for hours. 

The only thing I tried here was the coffee and I forgot what else I ordered, I was a little anxious about ordering first without having a table. 

The prices are a bit on the high side but its worth it if you plan on using the wifi. Not a good breakfast to come with friends, its more like a solo type place.
author: Victor L.

description: Mary tried the waffle with fruit and a turmeric toddy. Me, the chia bowl with coconut & flaxseed. All nicely presented and yummy. St. Jorge adopts a Portuguese ambience with good effect.
author: Mel S.

description: Had cafe au lait and avocado toast there today and both were just OK. Long line since it was a weekend but service was fast.
author: K C.

description: Ordered a latte and avocado toast on this 4th of July 2017. Pretty packed as I walked in but as I was ordering a few seats opened up so I was able to enjoy my breakfast inside. They serve stumptowns coffee here which is good. As for the avocado toast... I personally didn't really like it as I think there was way too much lemon juice and it over powered the sea salt and olive oil. The avocado was thick and the chilli powder gave it a good touch.  I will be back.
author: Jan H.

description: Adorable little cafe nestled in the Mission. Great options for vegetarian and meat eaters alike! Had the breakfast muffin (veg friendly) and the avocado smoothie. My friends had the orange blossom waffle and it was so beautiful. Solid coffee as well
author: Lynley C.

description: This place is great. It is super close to my apartment and a go to spot in the neighborhood. It is also dog friendly! You walk in and the high ceilings and ton of natural light instantly lift your spirit. The place is a cafe so you have to order at the bar and get a number. On Sunday mornings, you better believe there is a huge line. There are plenty of tables and some dedicated to people working and others protected for people eating. The food is all super fresh and organic. They have a fantastic variety of juices and smoothies, which are a little expensive 7-9 dollars each, yet delicious and filling. I got the quinoa salad which was sweetened naturally with fruit and nuts, no heavy dressings. It was protein packed with quinoa that was well balanced with the tart arugula. My boyfriend got the mista sandwich which was ok...this is not the place to get a ham and cheese sandwhich. Take advantage of the fresh fruits and veggies whether it is as a juice or meal. The coffee was terrific too. I will be back!
author: Anne S.

description:
This place has been on my list for a "quaint breakfast/lunch" - such a neighborhood gem.  While the location is a bit random (in Bernal Heights off of Mission Street - a bit south of all the shops off of Mission/Valencia), it's definitely worth the walk over.  We live in the Mission, and it's only a short walk; but even if you don't live in the Mission, I'd still recommend popping in. 

A HUGE fan of avocado toast, I had to try that.  I also added on their garden salad as well, along with a cold brew on tap.  My husband tried the grilled ham and cheese with bananas.  

Avocado Toast (4 stars) - This was such a unique twist on avocado toast; the bread looks really thick, but it's not dense, so not overly "bready".  The citrus with the spice of the pepper flakes was such a good balance - the lemon made it taste so fresh.  Oh, and the avocado - I really appreciated that they loaded that on; no skimping on ingredients here!

Garden Salad (2.5 stars) - Nothing special.  But really, the main focus of my brunch was the avocado toast; I was just looking to add on something light to accompany my toast, and this worked just fine.

Cold Brew Coffee (4 stars) - Delicious - highly recommend.  Just a word of caution, as with any cold brew coffee, it's highly caffeinated.  So if you're susceptible to caffeine, just watch your amount of intake of this stuff ;)

Grilled Ham, Cheese & Banana Sammy (5 stars) - Holy moly, this was excellent.  I, being a lover of sweet with savory...knew this would be delicious.  But my husband (as I imagine others would be) was a little skeptical, but decided to give it a go.  He couldn't get over how good it was - he was like, "We are coming here all the time!!!"  I had a couple of bites as well, and it was over the moon delicious.  Decadent without being too buttery/messy (as some grilled cheeses can be). Highly recommend.

Overall, this place is SUCH a cute neighborhood stop.  The ambiance is adorable, laid-back, and bright.  I would definitely recommend stopping in for a coffee break, brunch/lunch/breakfast, or even a laid-back HH (they offer wine and small bites / plates that sound great).  So happy about this find!!
author: Rachael S.

description: Since first opening, it's definitely obtained a large hipster following, but that doesn't dampen the dining experience one bit. The vibe is casual and laid back, the music light and never overwhelming. As a vegan, I am delighted by the menu! Top recommendations are the the Avocado toast and the almond butter toast. Oh, and the brownie- Amazing!
author: Kristina B.

description:
Service: 1 Stars 
Food: 3 Stars 
Consistency: 5 Stars (consistently bad)
Decor: 4 Stars 

My order did not have any issues though I witnessed multiple waiter/cashier errors with my friends' orders. 

One friend ordered a macchiato and received a latte. The same friend ordered a grill sandwich with a side of avocado mash and received the sandwich as well as avocado toast. The waiter then proceeded to take both dishes back, even though the sandwich was correct. He also forgot to automatically refund the extra order until my friend reminded him.

Another friend ordered avocado toast and got avocado on an untoasted slice of bread. When her replacement order arrived, the toast was just shy of burnt on the underside.

For the price point, I expected better.
author: Sheila M.

description: My wife has a dairy allergy, so whenever we travel we always keep an eye out for vegan bakeries. This one did not disappoint! The baked goods are exceptional, and the coffee was great! I'd recommend this place more for the baked goods than for the savory items, but it was altogether a very good experience. My wife tried their vegan peanut butter cups, and they were the best either of us have ever had!
author: Seth S.

description: I liked the atmosphere here and the staff was very nice! However, they were out of the ingredients for the first thing I ordered, and my second and third choices. Fortunately, they did have the right stuff for my fourth choice which was really good and it came out right away. My friend's salad took an extra 20 minutes, though. I would go back again.
author: Kimberly T.

description: The classic over-priced avocado toast on the menu but everything is absolutely delicious and the WiFi is free! It's a cozy European style neighborhood cafe with good natural lighting.
author: Liza S.

description: Cinnamon sugar toast and the breakfast slider are to die for!!!! Keep telling myself I'll try other breakfast spots but always wind up back here... the free Jeff Goldblum stickers definitely don't hurt either
author: Sally F.

description: After just returning from Portugal, we had to come here and try the food, and it did not disappoint. Everything was fantastic. The music though did not fit the establishment.  The pasteis de Nata was so delicious ...
author: Ed A.

description:
Avocado toast, please!!!

I have appointments in this part of town regularly, so this is my go to coffee shop whenever I'm in the Mission/Bernal Heights area.

The baristas are always friendly here with no hipster attitude and this café serves breakfast, sandwiches, and Stumptown coffee! It's pretty good for working with the shop lined with two long benches and four two tops in the middle.

I've gotten their coffee drinks, chia seed bowl, and avocado chili lime toast. It's a take your number to the table and bus your table yourself kind of place with good WiFi, but slightly uncomfortable seats. I wouldn't recommend it if you're interested in working here for a while. The height of the seat to table ratio is off and the tables are very high, making typing rather uncomfortable. 

I definitely want to come back to try more of their toasts! Besides avocado toast, they also have cream cheese, almond butter, and cinnamon sugar toasts. I can't wait to come back to try those, too!
author: Katrina L.

description:
LOVED this place for breakfast.  First of all, they sell STUMPTOWN coffee - brewed in Portland.  Love this coffee - so I was ecstatic to see this upon walking in.  The first day I came in and ordered the egg sandwich slider with avo and arugula on Portuguese sweet bread.  It was the perfect size and oh-so-yum.  

We loved this place so much, we came back specifically to try their chia bowl another day - I've never heard of soaked chia, but you better believe I am going to do this at home now.  They soak the chia overnight in their homemade almond milk, and it has a consistency of eating tapioca.  It was topped with cinnamon, blueberries, strawberries, bananas, dates, seeds, and almonds.  It was good texture with added crunch and not overly sweet.  I truly enjoyed this meal and had a fresh squeezed green juice with it.   

The place has several small tables inside and a couple outside.  You walk up to order at the counter, and take a number, and they'll bring your food out after you wait for your drinks.  Cute little notes on the wall ask that you not stay longer than 60 minutes at the tables during busy times - they say this with humor, which is appreciated.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Nancy T.

description: Don't hate on my favorite cafe! This place is amazing, vegan options for me and meat for my meat eating friends. This is a great establishment and they know how to treat they're customers, well! I go here 1-2 times a week, I would go more but that'd be weird/slightly obsessive. But they have Stumptowm coffee which is hands down the best coffee ever. Ever. Ever. Go there, eat, enjoy, but don't hate or be rude. The staff is marvelous!
author: R R.

description:
Cafe St. Jorge is a cute little cafe in Bernal, not tucked into the center of downtown Bernal so it's more accessible to the rest of us (right of Mission St). The cafe has free wifi, a clean bathroom, ample seating, good lighting and a wealth of outlets. On a weekday I grabbed a seat no problem but was surprised by how busy it got by 11AM.

The cappuccino was good (they use Califia Almond Milk!), but I really came for the portuguese egg tart ($2.50. I had Lisbon's famous Pastel de Belem and still dream of this delicious pastry, and I hoped Cafe St. Jorge would offer something similar. Had I never known the deliciousness of Lisbon's Pastel de Belem I may never have been disappointed, but this one was not as creamy and tasted a bit like it was dried up at the top. They are also alot smaller in real life than I had expected based on pictures.

Overall, cute cafe good for laptop campers. A menu of very delicious sounding items - from savory pastries to avocado toast - however, skip on the portuguese egg tart and come early to grab a seat!

Pro-Tip: credit cards accepted, minimum purchase required. Punch cards available.
author: Jess C.

description:
I love this place, but I can't get the internet to work on my phone or laptop. :/ The food is not my style but looks good. Coffee, ambience, and staff are all great. It's my favorite neighborhood coffee spot.

Update: I had to turn "Hotspot 2.0 Networks" to connect. Upgraded to 4 stars now :)
author: Chuck T.

description: Best gluten free lemon cookie I ever ate! The jasmine green tea I had was great since I'm temporarily coffee free.  Also, they have live acoustic original music as well.
author: Evangelene G.

description: Nice little place to hang out with a laptop and work. Free wifi is good. Have plugs for power cords. I went for late lunch and I'd say that the lunch menu is a bit limited, but what they do have is really yummy. Tinned Portuguese sardines and Portuguese cheese.... delicious. Make sure you get the fava bean puree to go with. Coffee is good quality, service is friendly. Casual vibe.
author: Kylie F.

description: What a cute, hip little cafe. Great place to spend your Saturday morning. I really appreciate the little details of this place- old refrigerator in the corner, indoor/outdoor seating, and a small books/game collection. They also serve Portuguese Madeira and beer! The pastels are what I would come back for though. They are so delectable, eggy, and creamy mmmmmm. I also ordered the baked egg breakfast slider which was pretty delicious however kind of small. I haven't tried their hot coffees or chia pudding bowl yet but that's what I will be getting when I return!
author: Jeanie L.

description: Was looking for place quiet to get some work done. Was able to find parking right across the street and between 8 and 9 am the parking meter was free. Ordered a pot of tea and it was good tea. The place was quiet in the morning with a nice ambience. My table had crumbs on it and was rickety, but it wasn't too bad. Would come back if I need to find a quiet place to work again.
author: J C.

description:
Do yourself a damn favor and shutdown Yelp now cuZ you found your dejeuner/brekkie spot. Cafe St Jorge is the cats pajamas, the bees knees, the sweat on Larry David's eyebrow...maybe that one was a stretch.

Goose is Loose is a classic, orange waffles are fetch AF, and don't get me started on the smashed avocado. Coffee sent me straight to the Peru and the staff (from what I gleaned) are just stand out people. Go there, now.

Also, they have free stickers...RIGHT??
author: Ryan W.

description: Great spot for a quick bite to eat. I came here by myself, hoping to use my laptop and get something to eat at the same time. Unfortunately, they don't allow laptops at the tables from 9am-2pm. Ordered an avocado chili toast and a small coffee (I believe it was Stumptown). While paying, I noticed they have a bunch of baked goods at the counter and ended up getting a Portuguese egg tart. Got my number for my order and then sat at the counter near the front of the cafe. My toast took awhile to come out. I had to check up on it and then it finally came. They may have forgotten? Not sure, the server said it was ready right when he was about to ask the kitchen about it. The toast was good, perfect amount of spiciness from the chili. After I finished my toast, I decided to sit here and write a review.
author: Lina C.

description:
Although I have lived in the city for about two decades now, I have honestly never explored this part of it. A friend found St.Jorge on yelp after a yoga class in the Mission, and we decided to give it a try. St.Jorge is a decently sized cafe where the majority of people are on their laptops working away (they have free wifi), while also having a large menu to pick from. I asked the lady at the front (very friendly) what she recommends for a more filling meal, and she told me to try the Goose is Loose. The sandwich was a spin of a grilled cheese with some nice ham and bananas. As funny as that may sound, the bananas actually gave a nice sweet twist to the sandwich, without being overbearing. I also tried the matte, which was very fresh. My friend got the chia bowl, which is good for those avid fans of chia, granola, and fruits (too healthy for me).

I will have to come back for the fig toast (which is unfortunately only there 3 months out of the year).
author: Nikita K.

description:
Following in line with other reviews, I'd highly recommend this place!! Not a far walk from Noe Valley! 

Atmosphere-- the place is definitely on the trendier side, has a pretty "hipster" feel. It's small but there are quite a few tables. I've only ever been on the earlier side (9:30ish am) and I always find a table. Wouldn't be surprised if the place filled up for the later brunch hours though. You can also take it to go I'm pretty sure, so that's something to consider if you live close by. 

Food/drinks-- The chia bowl (+ granola & coconut) is the way to go. Feels healthy but is also really filling. Expensive, but I love it so to me it's always worth it. I've also tried the baked egg breakfast sandwich and that's great as well. Would recommend. I've had the avocado toast, and it's great, but I always feel somewhat guilty ordering avocado toast as its so incredibly easy to make at home. But if you're set on ordering it, you won't be disappointed. The coffee is fantastic and they have almond milk! Always enjoy an iced almond milk latte here. They also have a huge selection of pastries/baked goods that also look very freshly made, although I've always been too full on other things to ever try.

Overall, I would highly recommend, especially as a more low key alternative to the weekend brunch scene. Not entirely sure-- but I think the food might only be offered on weekends, so anyone coming during the week should definitely call/look into that first!
author: Katey P.

description: It was pretty delicious. The chia seed bowls are the jam! Avocado toast was good but not the best I've tried (lots of competition. eh?). I would definitely go there again.
author: Carley K.

description: I got a cappuccino here today made by Allison. It's one of the best I've ever had...  she was very nice and helpful, she taught me the difference between whole milk and almond milk. Awesome barista
author: travis m.

description: The interior is very cute and the baristas are really friendly. Tasty food. All ingredients are fresh and high quality.
author: Bella B.

description:
DELICIOUS LATTE. So pretty and yummy. 

This cafe is adorable. I'm here on a Sunday morning and it's pretty busy but there seems to be enough seating for the combination of ppl working on laptops/chatting with friends/enjoying a yummy latte. 

Pretty big pastry selection. I noticed 2 different gf/vegan cookies which is great. The barista brought out a chia bowl to the next table over and I immediately started to feel order envy. Next time, steph, next time.
author: Steph D.

description: Cozy cafe with super healthy and delicious lunch, brunch menu. The interior is very cute and the baristas are really friendly. The egg sandwich was awesome!
author: Madalynn K.

description:
Thank you for the delicious cold brew that went with my meal and creating an atmosphere that made it so much more enjoyable to catch up with a friend!

I came here for brunch with a friend on a Tuesday around 11am, no waits in line and no waiting for seating. We got to enjoy the Portuguese egg tart warmed up and it was so delicious! I also enjoyed the savory waffle with ham and arugula. I microwaved my leftovers later on that day and it was still good! I'll be back!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Came to try this cafe on a weekend morning after seeing a few friends post about it. Ordered a cappuccino, the baked egg breakfast slider, and the avocado chili toast.

Everything was fresh and clearly made with quality ingredients, but nothing too special. Coffee was made well and tasted very good. The breakfast slider was a good, hearty sandwich. The avocado chilli toast seemed like it had a few too many flavors going on for my liking. 

I did enjoy the board games that they have inside. It was a good way to get the brain going in the morning. 

Overall, nothing bad, but nothing spectacular. Worth a try if you're in the neighborhood in the morning though!
author: Malika R.

description:
YUM! I really enjoyed the late lunch I had here today. Got here with my party of 4 on a late Sunday afternoon and there was no wait for a table, and also a good number of parking spots available on the street (metered and non-metered). I just had a regular mug o' coffee but their lattes and cafe au lait looked really good! Would definitely get one of those for a cozy morning (although no laptops allowed during peak hours!). I tried their avocado chili toast and cream cheese toast with honey and berries, as well as a bite of The Goose Is Loose sandwich (ham, cheese, and BANANA. yes, you read that right.) - all of which were sooo good, especially the sandwich which we were really intrigued by! Their menu says "trust us" and we did, and it didn't disappoint. What a surprising and odd combination, but just as they promised, it just worked! Will try to recreate that flavor combo at home next time :) Both of their toasts were also delicious and I could see myself coming here quite often if I lived in the area.

Two little minor complaints / suggestions:
- Give a better knife to go with the toasts because it was hard to cut through the thick crusts!
- One of the servers was a tad on the rude side; there was some miscommunication about finalizing the payment (my mom's not used to the iPad process) and when we realized we'd forgotten to order the sandwich, and when we went back, the same tad rude guy mentioned above said something along the lines of "holy cow, more?" -______-

BUT, regardless, I really, really enjoyed the food and am sticking with 5 stars!
author: Kathy L.

description:
Beautiful, sunny cafe, warm and friendly service. This cafe absolutely nails the fusion of authentic Azorean food with really fresh California cuisine that is as nourishing as it is tasty.

I had the savory waffle, which was excellent--perfectly fresh, crispy exterior and warm and doughy interior, lightly sweet to match the gooey Portuguese cheese, fluffy scrambled eggs, crisp, refreshing arugula and loads of creamy avocado (in place of the bacon option). I'm not much of a meat eater but now I get the chicken and waffles craze!

Great spot to get some work done or read a good book (this cafe limits laptop usage during certain hours).
author: X-topher B.

description:
Cafe St. Jorge 100% didn't exist when I lived in San Francisco. What a bummer - I'd have surely been a local up on first my first visit.

It's got all the markings of what an SF coffee shop should be, but with a Brazilian twist that makes it entirely unique. You'll see this in some of their unusual pastry offerings and some left of center coffee drinks. And with a blue and white tile decor, you'll certainly feel a sense of calmness overcome you upon walking through the front door. In a saturated coffee market, they found a wrinkle that sets them apart from the crowded caffeine race.
author: Ruggy J.

description: When I first walked in, it was very welcoming. The environment of the cafe is amazing and seems like a great place to get work done. The staff was also friendly and the lady at the register was very helpful in helping my first time experience be a great one. I went with The Goose Is Loose, and as far as it sounds to put banana's, ham, and cheese together, it was amazing. I'm definitely coming back, this time with my girlfriend!
author: Marco A.

description:
Saturday, 1:00 PM.

Quickie:
+ Food quality
+ Service
- Hygiene
+ Strong wi-fi
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
+ Layout

And then...?
Amiable staff, good food, and a solid place to work. Thumbs-up!

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. Fig Toast
     + Marries contrasting flavors

Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
author: Chuck N.

description: This place is great! The food is good, made out of fresh products. They also have very healthy and tasty drinks, such as their avocado smoothie. It is usually crowded in the morning, but it is a good place to work in the afternoon. The service is really nice and helpful.
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description:
If you're a health nut, or enjoy the organics, or even just prefer something delicious, COME HERE. 

I'm a huge fan. The place is quaint with lots of wonderful reminders that you should be on vacation on a far away island. The coffee is wonderful. They serve stumptown. I love stumptown! The breads are wheaty and grainy. They taste wonderful with the almond butter, honey, and peaches. The sandwiches look a bit small but from what I see, people order it left and right with a smile on their face after each and every bite. 

Just do it. I love this place. I want to go back now; even though I just finished my lunch. ;D
author: Marlene T.

description: This is an adorable coffee shop with sweets, basic foods and nice drinks. Cozy atmosphere and very friendly customer service.
author: Tenley P.

description:
Lovely little cafe with a diverse menu. A bit overpriced and the quality doesn't quite match up but at least it's a nice study spot. I came on a weekday around 10am and the place was pretty packed but there were 2 tables open in the no outlet middle aisle of tables. There were outlets along some of the bench spots, a tiny nook on the side, a few high chair tables in the corner, and free wifi. Parking was also really easy. There's side streets with free street parking, otherwise there's a lot of 2 hour metered parking. You may be able to push your luck with the meters. I stayed in my car for half an hour after I left the cafe and didn't see anyone come by to ticket me until I was about to leave.

This place makes for a terrific study spot and the service is very nice though the prices are a bit steep. They serve a lot of "modern" cafe foods like avocado toast, smoothie bowls, and chia seed puddings. Honestly you could make a lot of the items yourself. I ended up getting the Savory Waffle and a Cold Brew. The Cold Brew was bright and mild. I really enjoyed it. The Savory Waffle was a bit strange. It was basically a waffle with a melted Portugese cheese called Ilha Azul + ham topped with arugula. It's served with maple syrup on the side. It had all the basic flavors to balance each other out and it kind of worked? The black pepper in the waffle could've stood out more but at least the arugula brought in some of that pepperiness and bitterness. The waffle itself was light and slightly crispy which was great. The cheese turns plastic-like pretty fast so you don't want to wait too long to eat it. Tt was kind of good but for $13, I wouldn't get it again.

Overall, a good spot in the city to get some work done and have a light lunch or breakfast. I'll probably be back.
author: Vivian C.

description: Expensive and may not enjoy the Portuguese style cheese in their sandwiches. Cookies and their freshly made drinks are worth trying.
author: Dharti D.

description:
My favorite cafe! It has everything I look for in a cafe to get work done. 
-Although the cafe is on the smaller side, there are plenty of seatings
-lots of outlets
-free Wifi
-good food and drinks! 
-friendly staff 

I appreciate the variety of food they offer. From pastries, to toasts, to sandwiches. Also, they serve Stumptown coffee which is a hugee plus! My favorite items so far are the avocado toast and banana smoothie. Oh and anything coffee :)

Since about a year ago when I first started coming here, they've definitely added on to their menu and space as well as bringing in a lot more people. This is great! However the cafe is usually very busy and a bit noisy in the peak hours . Finding a seat is slightly harder now. I'm not trying to complain because I still love coming here, but it's just a precaution! 

4 stars because pricing is just a bit high. A toast and latte comes up to $8. However, the quality and service is great so I guess it evens out :P
author: Norine L.

description: We're from Melbourne, with rich coffee and cafe culture. We really can't stand American breakfast. This place has vegan friendly food, very good coffee, yummy toasts, especially avocado on toast! It's very close to something we're used to back home. Thumbs up from me!
author: Jackie J.

description:
Café St. Jorge embraces a sophisticated yet simple breakfast, brunch, and lunch menu while still maintaining a casual, laptop-y coffee shop vibe. 

There are plentiful vegan options here, all clearly marked on the menu, which is a definite plus. I hate having to bother the servers with questions about what I can and cannot eat, and there's always the risk of deception. This place is an open book. V means vegan, VO means there is a vegan options. Easy peasy lemon squeezy!

On my first visit, I tried the Orange Blossom Waffle topped with fruit. I didn't taste much orange nor blossom, but it had a crunchy exterior and soft interior, the way a proper waffle should be. I thought that the outside was perhaps a touch overcooked (i.e. a bit on the hard side), but I let the maple syrup soak in to soften it up.

The second time around, I wasn't feeling super hungry, so I just went with the avocado toast. It's $5.75, but you get a pretty generous slice of bread smothered with a ton of gorgeous, sexy, perfectly ripe avo and a sprinkling of chili flakes (I wanted more, more, more!). If not for the price tag, I think I could have devoured at least a couple more slices. Ironically, I don't think they toasted the toast, as it was served at room temp. Do they pre-toast the toast? Gosh, I hope not.  

Their lattes are unimpressive. On my last visit, it was way too foamy and lacked that bold, delicious espresso flavor I have come to expect. No latte art, either. They brew Stumptown Coffee, for you coffee aficionados. They also offer almond or rice milk for you dairy-free cuties. Maybe the cold brew tastes better? I will sample a glass of it next time.  

It's a little spendy, but if you're feeling extravagant, I would give them a try. Go on payday & nibble and nosh to your heart's content!
author: Brandi W.

description:
Welcome to Ground Zero for gentrification in the lower Bernal neighborhood.

Want to interact with some of the local culture & people that have been here for decades?  Want to be introduced to new foods and styles you haven't tried before?  
Want to save money and buy a reasonably priced cup of coffee or tea?
Then don't show up here.

This place is overpriced to say the least, swarming with drones spaced out on their laptops, and looks like a European wannabe delicatessen.  Techies and fake yogis love this place.  If that's you, and you want to hemorrhage money for tea, then this is the place to be!!

If you want to try something truly local + better, go to the cafe a couple doors down.  Or go up Cortland Ave. to Progressive Grounds Coffee.  Go to Al's diner (open until 3pm) for some great breakfast and all-you-can-drink coffee.  Or go anywhere else, really.
author: Thomas T.

description:
This place never disappoints. Good quality coffee, authentic snacks, & healthy brunch options! The staff is always super friendly & music isn't bad. Wouldn't recommend it for a place to study on the weekend mornings 10-2 because it does get busy. It's become a popular spot so they limit dining to an hour. Despite the mere restrictions, it's still a cafe worth visiting - whether it's to read a book or catch up with friends, it's a versatile gem settled in the southern mission. 

Stumptown Coffee. Their almond milk lattes are smooth. Cold brews are strong. 

Food Reccs 
- any of their toasts (can't go wrong go wrong w their infamous avo-chilli toast)
-chia bowl
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: Kind people, lovely space, great food and coffee. Could stay here for hours. Some of the tables were no laptop but had no trouble finding one
author: Michelle C.

description:
I'm a sucker for brunch already. And the fact that they have beautiful, instagram worthy food that ALSO tastes delicious? I'm downright sold. The cafe is lovely and decor is super inviting.

I got the Chia Bowl which is filled with chia, organic almond milk, cinnamon, dried figs, nuts, seeds, agave, dates, and fresh fruit. The Chia Bowl is the perfect amount of sweetness and all the nuts & seeds add a wonderful texture to the chia pudding. I loved all the different fresh fruit that decorated the bowl. It was so visually appealing & just as delicious to eat. I also got the Avocado Chili Toast & their seasonal Fig Toast that comes with cream cheese, figs, and fresh cracked pepper. All the toasts come on this nice, big thick slice of wheat bread. Both toasts tasted delicious! The avocado was a nice thick schmear and tasted wonderful with the squeeze of lemon. The chili flakes added a nice spice. I also loved the fig toast. I usually don't like cream cheese but it paired really well with the sweet, juicy figs. The pepper added a hint of zing too. My friend also got the Baked Egg Breakfast Slider which comes on a Portuguese sweet roll and has organic, free-range baked egg w/ Siracha butter, arugula, and melted Portuguese cheese. I tried a bite, and eggs were moist and fluffy, and taste soo good with the airy bread. 

Cafe St Jorge has so many options for breakfast & lunch. When I first came here, I legitamtely stared at the menu for 10 minutes because everything sounded so good. For breakfast in addition to the items I ordered they have a quinoa bowl, savory & sweet waffles, banana bread, a breakfast board (baugette, ham, Portuguese cheese, butter), cinnamon sugar toast. For lunch they have sandwiches, more board options, salads, and small shareable snacks/dishes. I definitely hope to come here again & taste all the rest of their delectable menu!
author: Joy W.

description: Simple menu, cozy seating, excellent espresso and friendly neighborhood patrons. They have several healthy and tasty options, as well as a few sugary, tempting pastries. Come early as space is limited. Heads up: Laptops are not allowed between 10 am and 2pm on weekends.
author: Linnea T.

description: I came here on a Sunday noon time, pretty crowded but I still managed to get a seat by the corner and it's definitely my favorite seat in this cafe. They served stumptown coffee, it was my first time having it and it's comparable to blue bottle in my opinion. The ambiance is also very nice and chill, the food and coffee is pretty affordable consider how everything is so expensive in sf nowadays. The only down side is their wifi blocks most of the web access. So I started to read rather than served on the internet
author: Teresa C.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. I almost don't want to review it to ruin the secret. I'm here almost every weekend. Cafe St. Jorge has excellent brunch, minimal lines, good coffee, and a cozy little atmosphere. 

Favorites: breakfast slider, breakfast baguette (ask for it toasted!), linguica rolls, the goose is loose, homemade ham and cheese pop tart, and their toast specials. They've had a fig toast special, and their banana, honey, almond butter one is a regular on the menu. Also as someone allergic to peanuts, their homemade almond butter cups are a nice little treat!
author: Amanda A.

description: Just because the food is expensive does not mean that it is amazing. I paid about $16 for a glass of orange juice (which came from a gallon jug, I might add) and the orange blossom waffle (which had no discernible orange flavor) topped with sliced fruit. It was nothing exceptional at all. My friend paid about $19 for a glass of orange juice and the baked egg breakfast slider with salmon, after which he was still hungry. Needless to say, I was not impressed.
author: Max V.

description: Love everything about this cafe, which is my go to weekend breakfast spot.
author: Tasha D.

description: I adore this cafe! Wide variety of sweet and savory snacks/meals and beverages, wifi, plenty of outlets, and lots of seating in a cozy atmosphere. Great place to find your inner peace and get work done or meet with a friend for some fabulous toast. I dream one day of coming in the morning so I can try their waffles. Live acoustic music on Saturday evenings - Andrea and Chris are extremely friendly and accommodating if you'd like to participate :)
author: Catherine V.

description:
Awesome little spot! I have been living in Bernal Heights for about 8 months and walked/driven past this spot several times and not thought too much about it. From the outside sign it looks a bit shabby and I was never too intrigued but then one day when I was looking for close and quick brunch spots I happened upon the reviews/menu on Yelp and was very interested by their menu! 
I took my dad and my boyfriend, who are a vegetarian and a voracious carnivore respectively. Both were excited by the menu and got delicious sandwiches they were very happy with, size wise and taste. I myself got the random combination of cinnamon sugar toast and a kale Caesar salad because they both looked great. I got the salad with balsamic instead of Caesar dressing which they were super accommodating about and they were both so yummy. 
They're menu is very varied and unique, I look forward to trying more of their different toasts, orange blossom waffle and olive oil and black pepper waffle with arugula and melted Portuguese cheese on top! 
The decor inside is cute and kitschy while feeling airy and light. It seems like a great place to work as well although the tables against the wall are a bit tightly squished in and make for awkward ins and outs.
author: saachi d.

description: I had to try their famous avocado chilli toast. The bread was thick and toasty. The mountain of avocado was fresh and was slightly acidic due to the lemon juice. The chillies were not that spicy and provided a good kick. The touch of salt was on point. They really know how to combine ingredients in a complementary fashion.
author: James S.

description: Food & beverage was delicious, customer service was amazing and attentive, cleanliness is an A+, atmosphere is relaxing, location is easy to find, parking is okay. Overall a great place!
author: Tuesday H.

description: I'd like this place a lot more if the staff were a little more predictable.  Sometimes they are extremely friendly and other times they are the opposite of that.  The last time I was there their internet stopped working; so I walked up to the counter and asked the guy to reset the router.  He refused and told me that it was my computer that was the problem.  When I told him that several people were experincing the same problem, he doubled down and continued to insist that my computer was the issue.  So we left and went somewhere else, where, amazingly, my computer stopped being the problem and was instantly able to connect to the internet.
author: Paul V.

description: Cafe St. Jorge has excellent coffee, toast, waffles and pastries. No wonder the line can reach all the way to the door at times. Seating is a bit tight, so get there early or after the brunch rush.
author: Judson M.

description: Really excellent breakfast place! They have some really unique items on the menu. The waffle with fruit was awesome. The chia bowl was really good (add granola!). Good coffee, too.
author: Jen G.

description:
Great place to catch up with friends, people-watch, and/or settle in and get some work done while enjoying a coffee and a casual bite to eat.

- Eclectic menu includes lite fare such as a chia bowl, avocado toast, grilled cheese sandwiches, and yummy pastries and smoothies 
- Free, fast wifi & lots of outlets 
- Interesting rotating artwork
- Schedule of live events

Menu is slightly over-priced, but I understand the need to charge more as I and others are certainly guilty of lingering for longer than we should given the cafe's cool vibes...
author: Jamay L.

description:
Delicious Portuguese tart! I have never had these outside of Macau so I can't compare it to much... (Don't be mistaken... they are NOT Chinese Eggtarts!)

I also got the avocado toast. It was pretty good. Filled me up and it's pretty delicious. Can't go wrong with avocado and bread, right? I think I'll start adding chili flakes to my avocados too!

The most interesting item I had here was the Goose is Loose! It was pretty much a ham and cheese panini with BANANAS!! It adds an interesting sweetness to the salty sandwich. It was a little weird but delicious! The bread was also perfectly crispy. :D

Can't wait to come back for more toast! And more Portuguese tart!
author: Carin S.

description:
