description: I'm a huge fan of avocado on toast but this one totally takes first place! The cappuccinos were really good too and the cafe had a very warm and happy atmosphere! I ended up coming here 2 days in a row on my vacation!
author: Emma P.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop in SF!
I've been in SF for a few months now (moved from NYC) and have been exploring all of the coffee options around town. And while everyone is raving over Blue Bottle + Sightglass (which are also good) this little Portuguese Cafe is by far my favorites. The space is welcoming, its a nice place to sit + enjoy a cup of coffee or wine + the staff is always on point. Each time I've been here I've experience different staff members and they have all been great!
Oh and I almost forgot the food, coffee, + wine are all fantastic!
I tend to get a soy cortado or soy flatwhite both are creamy and delicious. I've also had a handful of their pastries + some sandwiches which are all very nice. 
Like many of the other reviewers I have to touch on the pata de nata's. These little custard tarts are the closest thing I've found since being in Lisbon. While I wouldn't call them identical they are definitely tasty!
author: Nelli S.

description:
Went here a few days ago for breakfast with some friends visiting from out of town. The setting was very cute. Loved the over hanging lights. There were lots of vegan and organic options. 
I ordered the hummus sandwich with a home brewed ice coffee. It was delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: M H.

description: Been there twice now and I have to say, I love it! I am really impressed with the place. I love their traditional portuguese desserts as well as their gluten free and vegan treats. And of course their sumol! I grew up in a portuguese family and consumed these desserts often, they pass the test, and make me feel like I'm back home.
author: Erin S.

description: Yum! Great neighborhood spot with delicious food. Some of my favorites: avocado toast, sardine toast, and smoothies. What a pleasant place for brunch and they have lovely music Saturday evenings. Definitely a favorite.
author: Eva S.

description:
Terrific place. Choice of Hairbender or Holler Mountain Stumptown for my drop coffee!? Awesome.

Orange blossom waffle? Yes.

Great space, friendly atmosphere. Thank you!
author: Jon B.

description: try everything on the menu, this place is wonderful. i love the city ambiance with a hint of Azores flavor.  place reminds me of a breakfast at a hotel in "angra do herismo" Azores. i would love to eat here every morning. try the toast with avocado. the corn bread is great.
author: Louis B.

description: Love this place so much. Pastries are delicious, the coffee is smooth and amazing, and space is lovely and peaceful. Also the staff are not pretentious like the hipsters at fancy coffee joints in the city.
author: Chanda G.

description:
Great coffee, delicious treats, great lunch and breakfast and wonderful music. I couldn't possibly ask for more.

When the menu says "trust us" for the goose is loose - ham, cheese, bananas on sourdough - be sure to listen.
author: Jason T.

description: What a lovely place! The cutest decor, nice staff, lots of tables and portuguese sweets!! Just perfect! Latte was also pretty damn good!! I'm in love with this place!
author: Paloma M.

description: Stumbled upon this place because I was looking for a spot open late with free Wi-Fi... and it was way more than anything I could've imagined. The ambiance makes you feel like you've been transported to another place, and the food is healthy and unique. To my surprise and pleasure, their food portions are generous as well. With work to do, I was happy that there are plenty of electrical outlets as well. Best part of all was staying through 8 pm, when a live singer began performing! I got to mix work with pleasure, thank you Cafe St. Jorge!
author: Nicole M.

description:
This cafe has the best of everything: good coffee, a wide selection of sweet and savory dishes, cute-yet-laidback decor, convenient seating at most hours, and friendly staff.

For pastry lovers, try their delightful Portuguese custard tarts, called Pastel de Nata. For folks who want vitamins, try the Quinoa salad.
author: Kaitlyn T.

description: Holy cow, much delish!  Enjoyed our friends' wedding reception here and talked about how lovely and tasty everything was for days.  Will definitely return next time we're in SF.
author: katinka p.

description:
Finally, some Portuguese culture that isn't Grubsteak.

This is the revival of the old Nervous Dog Coffee. Well-prepared Stumptown Coffee (and yes, they call an espresso shot a "Bica" as well, as they do in Lisbon), some Portuguese pastries, and even Portuguese fado and contemporary music on the speakers.

It's only a soft-opening, so it's going to need a check back. But promising thus far.
author: Teddy B.

description: Delicious new breakfast place in our hood! It has some great new ideas for breakfast, like the Chia bowl and the avocado toast. Both were so yummy! My hubs got the linguica rolls and the waffle and they were equally delicious. The almond latte was good, but very small, more like a cappuccino so I went back and got a cup of their regular 'Stumptown' coffee which was so delicious. $2.50 for a cup, $4.00 for refillable. It's an extra bonus that they have almond milk to add to your regular coffee. Very friendly staff and cute decor. Highly recommend!
author: Stacy M.

description: Delicious lattes; fruit bowls to perfection; avocado on toast just lovely; croissant morning bun exquisite. The atmosphere is "happening," with weekenders filling the place with their good energy. The little book exchange was another charming addition.
author: Kathy S.

description: This place is great! Fantastic coffee (including Stumptown cold brew on tap), friendly staff, tasty food (especially the chia bowl for breakfast!), and an appealing atmosphere with local art and occasional live music. A perfect neighborhood spot!
author: Tim D.

description:
Cafe St. Jorge is soon to be your favorite chill cafe and date spot. The interior is incredibly cute and well put together - reminds me of some Mediterranean spot despite being on Mission Street. The coffee is Stumptown and top notch. It's an escape from the overly acidic SF style coffee that is the trend these days. Food is something to behold and I HIGHLY recommend the grilled cheese. It's Portuguese inspired and also has a few good vegan dishes too for those so inclined. 

This is a must visit cafe and will be a welcome staple for the area.
author: Andrew L.

description: Neighborhood cafe with a hip Portuguese twist. Solid place to get some work done or just enjoy a cup of coffee on a Saturday. They have healthy vegan and meat eater friendly options. The baked egg breakfast slider  Is a great way to start your morning!
author: Sandeep C.

description: Excellent cafe and coffee shop! Coffee is perfect, cookies are amazing, breakfast is varied: indulgent, healthy, simple. Great service and welcoming environment. Don't miss it!
author: Matthew B.

description:
This place rocks! Great coffee, food, and friendly people. Quiet enough to sit and do work (if I ever got around to doing work, which I don't...so hmmm...k, let's go with, it's quiet enough to play Plants vs. Zombies on teh iphone! Plus there aren't any real zombies in the restaurant, which is a bonus, because that would be pretty inconvenient. You'd be there trying to enjoy yourself and *boom* the undead be all up in your business, causing a ruckus.   

So to recap, you should go here because: 
great coffee, great food, friendly people, no zombies. 

note to self: Idea for a web-based comic involving zombie pastries. working title: "The Walking Bread."
author: N S.

description: We were wandering about looking for a breaky spot when we chanced across this gem. Almost like being back home in Melbourne! The chilli avo toast was delicious. Top it with an egg if you dare. Yum!
author: Sarah B.

description:
When I walk in during lunch, there are so many macbooks open that I feel like I'm in an Apple store.  They're probably here cuz the food is good.  

I'm not going to even attempt to explain what to get, because I can't pronounce/name any of the stuff.  

WIth very friendly staff and extremely clean, Cafe St. Jorge is a regular thing for me now.  I'd come here more often, except it's out of the way for me.
author: Dong T.

description: Surprisingly good portuguese style cafe/coffee house. Had sandwhiches and also sardine and cheese board. All unexpected and new tastes. Worth a try for sure.
author: Casey D.

description:
Really cool little cafe in the Mission. I'll keep simple and just say that the coffee was delicious, the service was very warm and friendly, and the decor/space is clean and bright. Also, the food is pretty damn tasty.

Only knock I can think of is the often dismal parking situation, but it's certainly not as bad as some SF neighborhoods.

Bottom line: if you're in the neighborhood, I'm not sure that there's a better place to get coffee.
author: Stephen R.

description: Stump town coffee should be enough to make you go here but this place has a lot more to offer. Cool environment, unique pastries and breakfast menu, and good music on all the time. My go to spot in Bernal.
author: jered h.

description: Still really glad this place is part of the neighborhood, but I'm increasingly annoyed by the service when the young male is manning the espresso machine. Attitude and ridiculous delays getting the caffeine out. For example today he cleaned the entire front end before bothering to start my latte, or perhaps more accurately never started it until I went up and asked about it. Just raised eyebrows and a half nod in response, no apology. Everyone else here is great so unclear to me why they keep this one person who has a bad attitude.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Great little cafe. Very beautiful space, lots of tables, good place to work. Has some nice Portuguese items on the menu (and the sweets jars). Loved the kale salad. Staff was super friendly.
author: Dave Y.

description: Love th e Chia bowl for $8.50.  Healthy and tastes good.  Parking a bit difficult at 6pm.  I parked after 5 min.  Quiet and clean cafe.
author: kyle f.

description: I love this place. Friendly owner and staff. Comfortable atmosphere. Great coffee and cool food options. Try the goose is loose sandwich! I am also always consistently impressed with the quality and variation in music. From bebop to indie rock but always solid. What else can you ask for in your local cafe?
author: Nick V.

description: Not good at all!! Cold coffee , poorly  toasted bread, place looks nice but they need to improve the quality and preparation of what they make, and my latte tastes like nothing extraordinary .. Good luck
author: Julio T.

description: I am a huge fan; the almond milk is my fav. The staff, friendly and service is prompt. Plus, their front signage which they update daily is hilarious. I Instagram it regular! So fun..
author: Tim D.

description: Service is at a snails pace, along with the rotten attitude.  I think I actually saw the girl behind the counter lick her finger and continue making a sandwich.  Where are your gloves? I did have the strawberry salad a month ago, dressing is wrong tooooo sour. Three stars for Stumptown coffee.
author: Joy P.

description: We enjoy the coffee (Stumptown) and Portuguese pastries--they have a good variety. In particular, the pastéis de nata are delicious. We also like the espécie (cookies). Lastly, the owner couldn't be sweeter. Would definitely recommend.
author: Matthew O.

description: Delicious juices!! Freshly prepared.
author: Jamie M.

description:
Nice place in Mission with great caffe and biscuits!
Ideal for work and spend some time with friends.

Daniele
author: Daniele T.

description: This is my new favorite cafe in the good. Nice ambience. Sunny. Kind people working the counter. And the sandwiches are good. Solid choice for a coffee or to work away from the office.
author: Paul K.

description: Adorable little cafe in a not-so pretty part of the city. While outside there is trash, shady looking people hanging out around cars.. inside, St. Jorge's delivers: good coffee, excellent (and unique) pastries, pleasant service, free wifi, lots of outlets, big ceilings, mostly ok music (though a little intense for a Sunday afternoon). Overall, a nice place to work. I only saw one or two people with food, and I didn't order any. But I'd come back.
author: Miriam L.

description: I really enjoyed this café. It's a cute new place with some tasting food options including some Portuguese items.  My friend and I shared the waffle, which was topped with fresh fruit and we had the grilled ham & cheese with banana...it was delicious!  Also enjoyed the Sumptown cold brew coffee.  Looking forward to going back.
author: Dilly M.

description: Here for the first time and loving it! Perfect for getting work done. Music is loud enough to enjoy but quiet enough to do work. Gluten-free ginger cookie was delicious, but I was very disappointed in the avocado with chili flakes...I think it was way too lemony?
author: Sofia M.

description: A super place for breakfast or brunch, a very fresh, seasonal menu, with vegan variations.
author: David M.

description: Definitely as good as it gets when it comes to a casual late morning breakfast. Coffee was outstanding and the food was the best I've from any comparable small joint. My wife and I got a latte and a cappucino, by far one of the best coffees (although those aren't too hard to come by in SF). But what really amazed us both was the plain bagel topped with a fresher-than-jesus avocado spread, lime (or lemon?) juice, a dash of olive oil and chili flakes. Un-be-lieve-able. So delicious. Then, to sweeten our palate, we got a thick slice of toast topped with bananas, almond butter, and honey. The food could not have been better. We left ready for our trek throughout the mission neighborhood to spy out some great murals.
author: Rosario V.

description:
i was surprised this place didn't live up to the hype.
but it's probably just me:
- i really don't like avo toast where the avo is mixed like guac, i prefer slices.
-i also didn't like the quinoa salad- just bland.
also, not to be too sensitivo, but it was a hot day when i went there & bernal /mission heats up quickly so it wasn't pleasant to sit there AND there were flies.
so, not crazy about it.
author: Kim Y.

description: Neighborhood Gem. Love this unique place. Great food you can't get anywhere else. Goose is Loose Sandwhich is awesome as well as the crostini. They also designed the cafe to match diners who are there on their own with one another to make more space. I just moved to oakland and I will miss this place.
author: Daniel B.

description: A great new cafe around the block from my apartment. Serving Stumptown coffee and yummy food. Friendly (cute) staff is always a plus. So glad to have them in the hood.
author: Joseph S.

description: Stumptown coffee, great ambiance, awesome food. I couldn't resist the home baked goods. I stumbled upon this new cafe in the Mission while checking out the record store next door- so glad I did. Great place!
author: Jason F.

description: Great place. Good Stumptown coffee which was only $2 + 50c refills. Lovely bright room.
author: Daniel B.

description: The staff is super friendly, the ambient is so good and the food is fantastic. Too bad it's in a far place of the city.
author: Rodrigo K.

description: Maybe I ordered wrong, but as far as their salads go, $10 for a "large" kale salad with avocado is not worth it.  It's more of a small-medium sized salad with just kale, parmesan, lemon, and half an avocado.  Overpriced and boring.  Plus 1 star for playing Air.
author: Jason D.

description: This place is awesome! The Portuguese pastries are amazing - the pasteis are great (remind me of pasteis de Belem) - coffee is good, interwebs is fast and reliable.
author: Fred A.

description: My wife & I looked forward to coffee with friends here... Another bernal business! However, the single occupancy 2 & 4top tables were the patron was busy online. Long done with food & nursing a latte forever... Hipsters hanging out. There weren't any seats together & no one was leaving. The nice woman suggest food to go? I won't be back anytime soon.
author: Chris Ellen M.

description: The barista's here really know how to make a good custom cup of coffee. And the food is nice and original. Give this place a try, you will not regret it. Many choices for you organic people too. Staff is very nice and friendly, always greet you with a smile. We have been going here enough that they already know what we are going to order before we get to the register.
author: Jorge P. G.

description:
Swell spot.  Super service. Good lookin' staff. Chiil vibe. Tasty treats. Dynamite drinks. Yes, some food items are little spendy (the toast and smoothie options could be knocked down a buck or two, ladies)  but they're fresh and usually well-portioned. 
Something for everybody -vegans too. 
Love the avocado smoothie, little arroz muffin-y thing, the free Jeff Goldblum stickers, the minimalist yet cool decor,  and Portugese accents. 
Can't wait to try some of the more lunch/dinner options like the sardine action. 

I like it here - I have brought out-of-town family, friends, dates, and just little 'ol me.
author: Carson R.

description:
$20 for a mediocre salad, a sandwich, and a cup of English breakfast tea. Cakes looked interesting, but I didn't try any.  $2 in quarters to park for 1 hour.  

If I come back again, it will be for pasteles y café, not lunch.
author: Bathsheba M.

description: This is the neighborhood cafe I needed. Great (Stumptown!) coffee, great food, relaxing atmosphere with good furniture and wifi. If you live even remotely near here pack up your laptop one morning and head on over for some delightful food and drink.
author: Jack D.

description: As always chia seed porage is amazing. But this time the service was a little bit unfriendly. Which is strange because they're usually so nice here.
author: Niko M.

description: My friend and I love this place.  I always order their sweets.  I've tried them all and sure love them.  My friend just tried their avocado toast today.  She said it was good but thought it was a bit overpriced. It might be too soon to say this, but this is not a place to order something other than their sweets... I love local shops, so overall, I like this place.... A LOT!
author: Mike M.

description: Seriously cute cafe, with really friendly service. Small but focused menu, and I love the cake/pastry selection. The Portuguese custard tarts are delicious and authentic - don't come here without having one!
author: Tennille D.

description: Stopped by as we were in the area and are Portuguese and wanted to check it out. Coffee was good; Pastel de Nata was almost as good as in Portugal.
author: Lena P.

description: *Swoon* I love this cute lil neighborhood cafe like no other. I'll admit, I was a tad bit skeptical of how noshworthy food in this particular part of Mission Street would be, but I truly fell in love with this spot when I tried their avocado toast and delish salad selection. Bonus points for anyone who happens to wander into this cafe while something yummy is baking (which is often!)-high ratings for food, ambiance, friendly staff and general good vibes!
author: Jenna V.

description: Gem of a cafe in the mission. Ample outlets  + free wifi to work. Yummy healthy food and stumptown coffee. Friendly service. Overall great spot on the mission/ bernal border!
author: Elana R.

description: The service here is friendly, which is rare in the coffee shop business in this city. I really enjoyed their ice tea and appreciated that they had free wifi. The cafe is well lit and decorated nicely. They also have Stumptown Coffee, which is wonderful. This is a nice place to grab coffee and catch up with a friend, read a nice book or study. I didn't get to try their food but it looked pretty good.
author: Raha G.

description: Ham and cheese sandwich was really really good, though a little greasy on the outside.  Blueberry smoothie was also good, but very small proportion. Hummus platter was satisfactory.  Oatmeal and chocolate chip cookie was delicious.  28 dollars for the above listed items? A bit too pricey.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Yum yum yum.  Cafe St. Jorge is the jam and the jelly y'all.  I just came back from my second visit there and had another fabulous experience.  This time I got the kale salad and the hummus sandwich. Both tasted really fresh, healthy, and most importantly, tasty!   My boyfriend and I travelled to Portugal last year and this place definitely exudes the vibe of this beautiful country. Andrea is the super sweet owner and she greets you will a smile and fun conversation.  I am so happy this place is in the the neighborhood and looking forward to many more visits.
author: wendy w.

description: Great lunch place ! Fast fresh and delicious. Portuguese specialities that are really good :-)
author: Sophie S.

description:
A beautiful space with delectable coffee and Portuguese pastries. Try the avocado on toast: it's a perfect breakfast. There are fresh juices and smoothies; I tried the Cocoa Almond Dream, and it was yummy.

There's free wifi and a few power outlets. The owner has been very nice and welcoming about me working from here a couple of hours every morning.
author: Rachel C.

description: I'm Portuguese and was excited to try this place but left disappointed. There's nothing on the menu that seemed authentically Portuguese except for tremocos, which aren't my favorite. Otherwise, everything tasted ok and the prices were reasonable.
author: Albert S.

description:
- A well curated collection of coffee, pastries and light food. I loved that there were two kinds of iced coffees, both slow brewed of course.
- Nice ambiance with plenty of space and plugs for working. Very friendly to those coming in to work solo. People are respectful and step outside to take calls and noise from talking duos and trios didn't reverberate loudly in the space.
- Owners gracefully handled the crazies that pour in off Mission St

Bottom line: Great spot and I wish them lots of success!
author: Molly N.

description: Yay, finally a good replacement to Nervous Dog! The people are super friendly, the coffee is delicious, and it's right down the block. What really makes this place awesome, though, is that it's the only place I can get almond butter and bananas on toast, instead of the usual peanut butter! Generally a great joint. Only reason for four stars instead of five is that it would be nice to have a few more vegetarian sandwiches on the menu.  :)
author: Laurel B.

description: Definitely on the pricier side, but they make a great cup of Stumptown coffee and have delicious gluten free bread. A beautiful space and nice folks work there. Happy to stop by for breakfast with a book.
author: Courtney B.

description: Wow. So happy to find a great coffee place in the neighborhood. We just moved to Bernal Heights and we were really worried about finding good coffee. We walked into this place on a trip back from Cole Hardware. They've got Stumptown Coffee, which was delicious. They also have these amazing custard tarts. Seriously mind-blowing good, particuarly when they're still hot.
author: Jonah H.

description: Cafe St. Jorge is hands down the best coffee shop in San Francisco. It seems like the owners here have taken note of everything that other coffee shops in the city and beyond do wrong and have corrected all of their errors in a space that just makes sense in every way. Unlike most coffee shops, they have really great food at reasonable prices (chia seed bowl, Portuguese-inspired pastries, green juices and avocado toast are highlights), well-priced coffee ($2 for 1 cup and $3.15 for unlimited), a nice beer and wine selection, really good music, GOOD wall art, and an incredibly friendly staff. They also don't stare you down if you're on your laptop for a few hours. Rather, they place little signs on your table that encourage other patrons to sit with you. The place is always full of people, a testament to how well-run and welcoming the space and the people who work there are.
author: Yana S.

description: Coffee is always fresh and espresso drinks are made with experience and love. Their salads and plates are unique to San Francisco, with obvious Portuguese flare and authenticity. I recommend any and all of the treats from the displays up front as I have never been let down. Service is friendly and down earth. Great spot when in lower bernal, not to be missed!
author: Nathan T.

description:
The first thing I noticed about this adorable corner spot, was the shiney new La Marzocca, powder coated to match the nauticle blue color scheme. The Latte did not dissapoint, the Portuguese themed vegan pastries were phenominal, and the owner Andrea was a really welcoming host. 

It was a little busy on Sunday, which is understandable for a cafe of this caliber, but stopping by on a Monday morning I found a seat open, enjoyed a tasty quiche, and muddled around on their free wifi. If you live in the area,are just passing by, or want to test Andrea on her Portuguese heritage, do yourself a favor and check this place out.
author: Rob C.

description: This is my favorite cafe for Saturday/Sunday afternoon. Their coffee is very good and slightly cheaper than other hip cafes in the city. It gets a nice mixed crowd and not everybody is on the computer. Their food is healthy and delicious and the staff is very friendly.. I manged to knock over a big glass of water that got shattered on the floor and nobody got upset with me... on the contrary... they asked me not to touch the glass so i wouldn't hurt myself... I really have only good things to say about them.. i  also love the fact that they are Portuguese... and offer some Portuguese snacks like those little beans that taste like cheese... forgot the name but go ahead and try them!
author: ania w.

description: We have been in dyer need of a good coffee shop in this area and were so glad when Cafe St. Jorge popped up. Everything here is amazing. I am a fan of the dark roast so I was thrilled to see Stumptown coffee. All of the pastries are delicious. My favorite thing on the menu is the avocado toast. So good! Also don't miss out on the smoothies or chia bowl.
author: whitney r.

description:
If you are looking to sit for a while, this place will do the job. It has a welcoming ambiance and lots of natural light. The chairs are hard - perhaps to deter you from spending the *whole day* there. Another thing to deter you is a local who frequents the place; she is *chatty* and eccentric. The quality of the coffee depends on the barista. I've had cups that range from meh to okay. 

wifi: Fast when it works. It works most of the time.

kids: There is a little nook by the front window for kids to read an play. Seems like the local parents like it enough.

arriving with a group: You wouldn't want to meet up with more than 3 of your friends here.

note, the "Thursday Game Night" advertised with flyers does not really happen. No one plays games here on Thursday nights.
author: Claire B.

description: great coffee, love stumptown! great coffee cake, great atmosphere. love this place and the staff is great too.
author: John B.

description: I've come here a few times when i go to thrillhouse records. Staff are very sweet and efficient and make a delicious coffee. Place has got a portugese euro vibe going on and i will have to check em out for breakfast or lunch in the near future. Place is friendly and cute...great addition to the neighborhood now that nervous dog is gone.
author: she o.

description: Nice setting, good drinks, working on the food. I think once they work out the kinks they're going to kick ass. Also, this place isn't super baby friendly, kind of surprising for the neighborhood...
author: Red Riding H.

description: I used to love this place but recently it's gotten filthy. There are crumbs all over the floor, flies everywhere, and last time I was there the staff charged me for extra salad dressing on a poorly dressed salad.  not feeling it any more.
author: Arielle R.

description: Solid! The avocado toast is delicious.  Really sweet service and cute setup.  Granola was a thumbs up minus the raisins were a little too chewy.
author: Candace D.

description:
Stumptown coffee. End of story.

The hours are funky so take heed before finding yourself without coffee at 3:45 pm. Some gluten free options.

Oh yeah, it's on the same side of the street as Safeway, Walgreens and the gas stations.
author: Tracy Y.

description: Amazing little breakfast spot with great healthy and fresh options. Love the Portuguese vibe. Must try the slider with Ham and avocado added and the avocado and chilli toast.
author: Ryan C.

description:
For a moment, putting aside the Azorean Portuguese food and angle, this is a really nice cafe to sit down and get your coffee. The coffee is very good, the owners are warm and friendly, and the interior is inviting and light filled. With the white and light blue Azorean paint scheme, the ambiance is a welcome break from the typically dark interiors of most cafes across the city. 

On the food side, we sampled three pastries: Bolo de arroz (sweet rice muffin), the pastel de nata (custard tart), and the especie (anise filling cookie). Andrea has nailed them all. 

The especies are spot on for authenticity. These rare treats are only found on the tiny island of Sao Jorge of the Azores (and maybe some of the neighboring islands), or from old lady Azorean immigrants in San Jose. You can't even find them in mainland Portugal. My wife and I hate anise flavored anything, but we love these. Andrea's taste exactly how you would find them on Sao Jorge, and you don't even have to travel 14 hours to get them.

The pastel de nata is a standard in mainland Portugal. I think these are tasty and I was happy to find them in San Francisco, if just for nostalgia's sake.

The Bolo de Arroz really shined. Andrea mentioned to me that she had altered the traditional recipe and I think she did a brilliant job with it. This muffin has a great balance of moistness, texture, and I think coconut milk? In the way that the pastel de nata is the signature pastry in Lisbon, I think Andrea has found her own for her cafe.

Although I didn't sample the savory section of her menu, I hope what looks like to be successful launch will allow her to expand the lunch menu to include some more substantial Portuguese dishes, although I understand that this place is a cafe and not a restaurant. It would rock out to have a place where you could get a bifana (hint hint Andrea, give us a wine-garlic pork sandwich).
author: Michael C.

description: Gluten-free lovers, this place is a must!  Their menu has lots of delicious GF options and their GF bread is the best I have ever had.  It is moist and tasty.  I am also a fan of their cofee
author: Ali H.

description: Delicious. The best breakfast in town. Lots of Fresh fruit on a delicious waffle. Egg sandwich on a home made Portuguese sweet roll bun with avocado thin delicious ham Portuguese cheese and a light egg. A must try  saw it on yelp and I am of Portuguese family from St Jorge so it was fun to speak to the owner chef
author: suzanne l.

description: This place is nice and the pastries are amazing. However the time i went it was full of hipsters working on their imac. There was not a single table without an apple laptop. When i walked in i felt like getting in a conference room for some business meeting. Really sad. I believe coffee places should be for people to read, chat, enjoy food or coffee and not for a feeling like being at work. It would be 5 stars for the pastries and coffee but it gets only 2 because i really got a rejection to that kind of laptop environment.
author: Luca R.

description: The perfect balance of everything... delicious (stumptown) coffee, good snacks and light breakfast and lunch options (Chia bowl is my favorite), super friendly staff, and a light, bright atmosphere that is great for meeting a friend for coffee or for getting some work done. You will be asked to share your table if it gets busy and you're on your laptop... I personally love this and feel like it contributes to a community feel. I've met many of my Bernal neighbors thanks to St. Jorge!
author: Christine C.

description: super yummy and great price and good vibes
author: Giovanie R.

description:
i haven't written a yelp review in years but i have to for this place. 

i used to come here when it was nervous dog (and liked it then) to get work done.  i was so sad when i saw it had closed but am thrilled with what's taken its place!  

cafe st jorge is just gorgeous to look at--the floors are beautiful, the tables are nice, there are outlets everywhere! the sumptown coffee is perfect and, best of all, the staff is just wonderful.  they are cheerful and friendly all day and don't mind at all if you sit for hours working.  i highly recommend this place if you have some studying or work to do, i always get a ton done when i'm here. i think i'll write my entire dissertation in this coffee shop! 

i haven't tried too much of the food but the granola and yogurt with fruit is delicious.
author: S A.

description: The staffs are very nice. They have plugs and high speed wifi.
author: Kyoko T.

description: The owner "gets it" is the best way to describe it. Was out for dinner and had an hour to kill before we could be seated and even though place was closing she invited us in and let us sip tea for 40 minutes until we left. Tea was good and baked goods looked really good. Owner was friendly and it seemed like her in-laws were cleaning up while we sipped tea. Have Stumptown coffee and place itself is really nicely decorated (much nicer than old coffee shop that was there). Will definitely come back.
author: Ben L.

description: My favorite work and eat spot! Amazing smoothies- especially the date smoothie, great pre-made juices, CHIA BOWL is fabulous. Great vibe, awesome employees, definitely pop a squat here!
author: Tara D.

description: This cafe is exactly what the neighborhood needed. It is my new favorite place to work remotely with its serene decor, big tables and strong wifi.
author: Anne H.
